newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Sea of white as Belgians call for justice clean-up.
newsitem.headline: Sea of white as Belgians call for justice clean-up.

text.p: Hundreds of thousands of Belgians turned the centre of Brussels into a sea of white on Sunday in protest against the failures of their political and legal system in a horrifying case of child sex abuse and murder.
The parents of four dead girls and two still missing led the march, dressed all in white and carrying white flowers.
Behind them, silent and serious, trooped sympathisers from all over Belgium, plus supporters from abroad, wearing white or carrying white balloons and flowers. Police estimated the crowd at 275,000.
Plain white banners fluttered in a chill wind from balconies along the route, the three km (two miles) boulevard leading from Brussels' North Station to its South Station.
Posters on some shops along the way proclaimed: "Stop the Cover-up by the Gendarmerie and Courts."

Belgian news media have repeatedly charged, but have not found proof, that there was a high-level police, judicial and political protection of a paedophile ring alleged to have been led by convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux.
The group are blamed for the deaths of at least four victims. Two other sexually abused girls were rescued from Dutroux's cellar in August.
One of the organisers, Paul Marchal, father of An Marchal who died at the hands of the child molesters, told the crowd to "Keep your fists in your pockets" and contain their anger.
"The criminals are much better organised than the authorities," Marie-Noelle Bouzet, mother of missing girl Elisabeth Brichet, told RTL television.
